title: Create Your First App
subtitle: Step-by-step guide to building your first application

sections.heading: Getting Started
sections.content: When you log in to Apper, you'll see a large prompt box in the center of the screen. This is where you tell Apper what kind of app you want to build, just like you're explaining it to a friend.

sections.heading: Example Prompts
sections.content: This will give you a much better starting point. Using this prompt, Apper will be able to generate your app more accurately based on your needs.

sections.heading: Step-by-Step: How to Write a Better Prompt with ChatGPT

steps.title: Open ChatGPT in a new tab
steps.description: Navigate to ChatGPT in your browser to start refining your prompt.

steps.title: Copy and paste the following prompt into ChatGPT
steps.description: "I want to build [Insert your app idea here]. Rewrite this as a detailed prompt focused on the app's main function and detailed features. It should be simple, clear, easy to understand, and ready to use in an AI app creator."

steps.title: Replace the placeholder with your actual idea
steps.description: Replace the part that says [Insert your app idea here] with your actual idea. For example: I want to build an app that helps users book yoga classes and pay online.

steps.title: Get the improved version from ChatGPT
steps.description: ChatGPT will rewrite your idea into a cleaner, more detailed prompt.

steps.title: Copy and paste into Apper
steps.description: Copy the improved version ChatGPT gives you, and paste it into the Apper prompt box.

title: The Apper Builder Interface
subtitle: Navigate and understand your app building workspace

sections.heading: Getting to the Builder Interface
sections.content: Once you submit your prompt, you'll be redirected to the 'Apper Builder Interface'.

sections.heading: The 4 Main Sections
sections.content: The Apper Builder Interface has 4 main sections, each designed to help you manage different aspects of your app:

sections.heading: 1. Customize App
sections.content: View and edit your app's layout, pages, and components. This is where you can see your app come to life and make visual adjustments to ensure it looks exactly how you want it.

sections.heading: 2. Manage App
sections.content: Control your app's settings, invite users, set up permissions, onboarding emails, and billing for your app (we'll cover all this in detail later). This section handles all the business and operational aspects of your application.

sections.heading: 3. Code (Optional)
sections.content: View or edit the code behind your app if you're working with a developer and want advanced customization. Important Note: No coding is required to use Apper; this is just for added flexibility.

sections.heading: 4. Database - Your App's Memory
sections.content: It's where your app safely stores and manages all its data. This could be anything from user details, form submissions, product lists, bookings, messages, or any data your app needs to deal with.

sections.heading: How Apper Handles Your Data Automatically
sections.content: Apper takes care of everything automatically and works quietly in the background to make your app run smoothly.

sections.heading: What Apper Does Behind the Scenes
items: Analyzes your app and understands what data it needs
Creates the right tables for your app's data automatically
Links related information together (like connecting a user to their orders)
Keeps everything updated in real time with your app's screens
Ensures data consistency and security at all times
Handles data backup and recovery automatically

sections.heading: The Result
sections.content: So when someone adds, edits, or views something in your app, the database is always working quietly in the background to make it all run smoothly. You don't need to worry about technical details - Apper handles it all for you.
